business.headline: Is the IPO craze over? Stock market correction hits public listingsSubscription figures for IPOs have dropped in recent months. Global economic uncertainty, rising interest rates, and tighter liquidity have made investors cautious.

I don't believe in work-life balance: Narayana MurthyNarayana Murthy said that hard work is key to national progress, citing Prime Minister Narendra Modi's long work hours as an example.

Since the start of 2024, the stock has risen by over 110%, moving from Rs 15.25 to Rs 32.50 per share.

SBI hikes home loan interest rates by 5 basis points. Check details  The change in interest rates is effective from November 15, and will make borrowing costs slightly higher for customers seeking loans from the State Bank of India (SBI).

Signature Global shares at over Rs 2,000? These 2 brokerages are bullishShares of Signature Global rose nearly 3.5% in the previous trading session after multiple brokerages raised their target price. Its total market capitalisation stands at 18,238.99 crore.
Piyush Goyal wants RBI to cut interest rates. Shaktikanta Das respondsUnion Minister Piyush Goyal described the link between food inflation and interest rates as an 'absolutely flawed theory.'

I'll take this with me to grave: Narayana Murthy defends 6-day workweek viewNarayana Murthy, who has been vocal about his views on work ethics and productivity, expressed disappointment over India's move from a six-day workweek to a five-day one in 1986.

'Wolf in sheep's clothing': Report flags Starlink's US military tiesStarlink operates through a constellation of satellites to provide internet access worldwide, a model distinct from traditional telecom services that rely on ground-based towers.

Stock markets closed today for Guru Nanak Jayanti holiday?Sensex and Nifty, have faced a six-session losing streak, marked by selling pressure from foreign institutional investors (FIIs) and worries over rising retail inflation.
Siemens layoffs: Tech giant may cut up to 5,000 jobs amid ongoing strugglesThe company's Q4 FY 2024 results highlighted the impact of global geopolitical and macroeconomic challenges.

Sensex, Nifty fall for 6th straight session as FMCG stocks decline sharplyThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 110.64 points lower at 77,580.31 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 26.35 points to 23,532.70.

More trouble for Ola Electric, faces probe over poor service standards: ReportThis comes after the Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) issued a notice to the SoftBank-backed e-scooter maker following a high volume of complaints.

Boeing layoffs: Aerospace giant to reduce workforce by 17,000Boeing Layoffs: The aerospace giant has faced financial challenges this year, pushing it to make these deep cuts to realign its current financial realities.
Markets in free fall: These sectors and stocks can be safe betsBoth the Sensex and Nifty indices have fallen around 10% from their 52-week peaks, marking a notable slump in the market.
Donald Trump's crypto push: Not just Bitcoin, even these tokens are soaringThe bull run is not only crucial in terms of Bitcoin's valuation but also in its wider impact on the altcoin market.

Trump factor, FII selling: Why Sensex, Nifty fell for 6th straight sessionThe benchmark Sensex dropped over 250 points, while the Nifty fell over 100 points during intraday trade, marking a significant 10% decline from their September peaks.

Can you expect major income tax changes in Budget 2025? Check detailsThe Finance Ministry has established 22 specialised sub-committees to examine various aspects of the Income Tax Act, with an aim to simplify tax structures, expand tax base, and balance revenue generation.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: 10 children killed, 16 injured in fire at Jhansi hospitalThe fire, likely caused due to a short circuit, broke out in the neonatal intensive care unit of the Jhansi hospital.

Cocaine worth Rs 900 crore seized in Delhi, Amit Shah praises anti-drug effortsThe NCB recovered over 82 kg of cocaine from west Delhi and arrested two people in connection with the bust. The consignment was valued at around Rs 900 crore.

Samson, Tilak power record-breaking India to T20i series win in South AfricaSouth Africa vs India, 4th T20I: Sanju Samson and Tilak Varma hit a hundred each as India posted 283 and hammered South Africa by 135 runs. On a record-breaking evening in Johannesburg, India completed a memorable series win and ended a memorable year in T20Is on a high.

Dharam or rozgar: What's the key issue in Maharashtra election? Rajdeep Sardesai's ground reportIn this episode of Maharashtra Majha, watch Rajdeep Sardesai's ground report from Nashik, Malegaon and Ahilyanagar as the state goes to polls next week.

Indians going to US for master's degree a scam? Reddit user sparks stormA Reddit user, claiming to be a 26-year-old American woman, said 99% of the students in her computer science master's degree class were Indians. She asked if Indians going to the US for masters was a scam and sparked a massive debate on Reddit and X. People, including tech influencer Deedy Das, revealed the ground reality.

Rohit Sharma and Ritika Sajdeh blessed with baby boyIndian captain Rohit Sharma and wife Ritika Sajdeh have been blessed with a baby boy. It remains to be seen if Rohit will make himself available for the 1st Test vs Australia in Perth.

Gautam Adani never attended our meetings: Devendra Fadnavis rejects chargeAfter Ajit Pawar claimed that Gautam Adani was present in the BJP-NCP government formation talks in 2019, Devendra Fadnavis clarified that the industrialist was never involved in such meetings.

In jibe at Samajwadi Party, BJP leader likens Muslims to 'bay leaves' in biryaniThe Samajwadi Party treated the Muslims as 'bay leaves in a biryani' and 'threw you out of the plate', Uttar Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister and BJP leader Brajesh Pathak alleged.

Haka: How a Māori tradition became New Zealand's cultural iconThe haka is not merely a dance; it is a powerful narrative of the Māori people's resilience, heritage, and connection to their ancestors. Each step and chant is a declaration of identity, making the haka a timeless bridge between the past and the present. Here is more about its origin and significance.

4.2 magnitude earthquake hits Gujarat, tremors felt in Ahmedabad, GandhinagarGujarat earthquake: The epicentre was 13 kilometres south-southwest of Patan in Gujarat's Banaskantha district, as per the Institute of Seismological Research, Gandhinagar.

BCCI flags Pak board's plan to host Champions Trophy tour in POK: SourcesThe Indian cricket board has raised its concerns with the International Cricket Council over Pakistan's plan to host the Champions Trophy tour in Pakistan Occupied Kashmir (PoK). ICC sources have told India Today that it would announce plans for the trophy tour soon.

How bloody siege of Mecca Grand Mosque 45 years ago split Muslim worldExactly 45 years ago, Mecca Grand Mosque, Islam's holiest place, was taken over by 200 armed men led by preacher Juhayman al-Utaybi. Blood would flow before the weeks-long siege ended. The events of 1979 turned Saudi Arabia into a radical Sunni country, and split the Muslim world, the impact of which is felt to this day.

Biryani was served to Kasab after 26/11 Mumbai attacks: JP Nadda slams CongressAddressing a poll rally in Thane, JP Nadda slammed Congress for mishandling national security during the UPA era, citing the 26/11 attacks. He praised PM Modi's decisive actions during incidents such as the Uri and Pulwama attacks.

2 killed as teens race on Srinagar highway, speeding car rams parked truckThe accident took place when four teenagers, in two SUVs, raced on the highway and one of the vehicles lost control and rammed a parked truck in Srinagar.

Tilak Varma smashed 120, the second-highest score by an Indian in T20is.

The Sabarmati Report review: Even Vikrant Massey can't save this confused filmReleased-Fri Nov 15, 2024The Sabarmati Report, featuring Vikrant Massey, Ridhi Dogra and Raashii Khanna, delves into the Godhra incident while exploring the divide between English and vernacular journalists, ultimately highlighting the power of local journalism. Read the review before you decide whether to watch the film or not.

How war of slogans in Maharashtra, Jharkhand has gone beyond bijli, paniFrom 'bijli, pani, sadak' to 'India Shining' and 'Ab ki Bar Modi Sarkar', slogans defined elections and described the politics of the day. What does the war of slogans ahead of the Maharashtra and Jharkhand Assembly reveal?

Alcaraz lost to Alexander Zverev in straight sets in his final group-stage match on Friday in Turin.

4th T20I Highlights: India clinch series by 3-1 after 135-run win in JohannesburgSouth Africa (SA) vs India (IND), 4th T20I Highlights: India have won the T20I series against South Africa in a dominant fashion after their 135-run win over the Proteas in the Johannesburg clash. Starting with Sanju Samson and Tilak Verma's record-filled centuries in the first innings, the likes of Axar Patel and Arshdeep Singh did their job with the ball to script a historic win.

India is refusing to travel to Pakistan for the tournament.

Asian Games medalist Prajnesh Gunneswaran announces retirement from tennisPrajnesh Gunneswaran, 35, announced his retirement from professional tennis on Friday, November 15. The former Asian Games bronze medalist reached a career-high of No. 75 in men's singles.

BCCI complains to ICC about Pakistan's plan to host Champions Trophy tour in POKWhile the International Cricket Council has not yet officially announced the itinerary for the Champions Trophy tour, Pakistan Cricket Board on Thursday announced it would be held across multiple areas, including three in the Pakistan-occupied Kashmir.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
